description.narrative: By 2018, all children in emergency situation benefit of the package of essential services of education in accordance with UNICEF core commitments for children in emergency, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, 100 per cent girls/boys of primary school and 70% girls/boys of 1st cycle of secondary school, particularly the most vulnerable, achieve quality and inclusive education, and 100% girls/boys and adolescents out of formal school benefit from alternative education.

mailing-address.narrative: D.34 Rue Lucien Fourneau Boite Postale 2110 Brazzaville

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, all children in emergency situation benefit of the package of essential services of education in accordance with UNICEF core commitments for children in emergency

description.narrative: 10,508 children (4,970 girls and 5,538 boys), including displaced children, refugee children and children from host populations, received school supplies and enjoyed the right to primary education and to improve their school completion and school success rates in Likouala and Pool regions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/02/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Emergency response - School aged children targeted by UNICEF that have access to psychosocial support in their schools/learning spaces during and after the humanitarian situation
